entry.title: massacre of 257 inhabitants of a Polish village (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during World War II, a Polish priest and a German officer could not prevent the massacre of 257 inhabitants of a Polish village (commemoration pictured)?

entry.title: Nickolas Zukowsky (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite not owning a road bike the year before, Nickolas Zukowsky placed third in the 2016 Canadian National Junior Road Race Championships?

entry.title: keep fresh grapes in mud (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that rural Afghans keep fresh grapes in mud?

entry.title: Paige Lorenze (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the New York Post called Paige Lorenze the "female Pete Davidson"?

entry.title: Crystal Dynamics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Crystal Dynamics was the first developer for the PlayStation outside Japan?

entry.title: Walter A. Groves (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Walter A. Groves received a job offer from Centre College by telegram around the same time that he was forced to leave his work as a missionary in Iran due to the country being invaded?

entry.title: being rivals since 1977 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite being rivals since 1977, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and the Green Bay Packers have only played each other twice in the playoffs, with each team winning once?

entry.title: Wrap Me Up (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jimmy Fallon and Meghan Trainor wrote their song "Wrap Me Up" over FaceTime, during which she described being "so nervous [her] heart was in [her] ass"?
